argsText: /light-gray Arguments: / U (up), R (right), D (down), L (left), F (forward)
descriptionText: Moves the target one tile in the specified direction.
Rotates the target 90 degrees right (clockwise) or left (counter-clockwise) relative to their current facing direction.
Jumps to and resumes execution from the line with the specified number.

argsText: /light-gray Conditions: / facing /red red, /green green, /blue blue, / wall
descriptionText: Executes the specified command only if the given condition is true.
exampleText: /light-gray Example: / IF FACING RED MOVE U

argsText: /light-gray Arguments: / U (up), R (right), D (down), L (left), F (forward)
descriptionText: Creates a clone of the target in the specified direction. The newly created clone starts executing the same program from the current instruction.
Stops the execution of all commands immediately.
Does nothing. Can be used as a placeholder or to represent an empty instruction.
